results.title: Australian diary. No. 022
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Scientists make strange finds in Arnhem Land during the American-Australian Scientific Expedition. They studied birds, fish and the culture of local Aboriginal peoples. A potter from Melbounre demonstrates a variation of the coil method of using clay. Koalas are born and reared in a sanctuary along with kangaroos and dingoes at the Lone Pine Koala Sanctuary near Brisbane.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 021
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Medical aid for the children of the far west. Officials of the Far Wesr Children’s Health Scheme visit Tibooburra school and aboriginal camp on the Queensland border. Experts milk lake trout of their eggs which are hatched at the hatchery and young trout are released back to the rivers in Victoria. Toronga Park Zoo kindergarten caters for young animal lovers. Modern machinery revolutionises heavy work; a demonstration of heavy machinery available to Australian industries from the Commonwealth Handling Equipment Pool.

results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Preserving mature’s bounty - canning fruit, vegetables and meat; rich asbestos mine in Western Australia; Sydney’s day nursery school.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 018
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: the Tobruk Memorial to the fallen is unveiled; champions start a boom in table tennis; banana growing in New South Wales is shown and the Wyatt Earp Antarctic Expedition is shown.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 016
results.brief_description: This diary features a ship from the Antarctic expedition which visits a deserted whaling station, the repairing of priceless art treasures, and a look at Manly Beach, a popular summer playground. No credits available.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 014
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Victoria converts brown coal to power and light at Yallourn in the Latrobe Valley. The mechanisation of Australia’s wheat farms from harvesting to transporting wheat to the silos is shown as the country celebrates a bumper crop. Army Minister revies a parade of school cadets from high and public schools at Ingleburn Camp near Sydney. Fairbridge Farm School at Molong in New South Wales helps new migrants create a future in their adopted country.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 013
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: This newsreel looks at Grafton in New South Wales - a centre of progress and culture. The shape of things to come in glass is highlighted. Experiments with lucerne demonstrate its amazing growth. The Sydney Harbor Bridge is painted and Armidale University is shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Australian diary. No. 012
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following items are shown in this interesting cinemagazine: logging red gum on the Murray; Youth and Fitness Week in Melbourne; transferring the Australian scene to textiles and the different codes of football found in Australia.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 011
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The desert is the setting for Australian boom town Whyalla, showing its development as a port and shipbuilding centre. Stars show their artistry at the ice carnival in Sydney. The Public Library of New South Wales is considered everyman’s university, and the collections of books, manuscripts and paintings are examined.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 009
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Commonwealth Department of Information
results.brief_description: This film of life in Australia in 1948 looks at the Dental College in Sydney, sheep dog trials and the Port of Sydney. No other credits available.
